abstract: Officials say small drone that evaded White House radar and crashed on grounds was result of drunken misadventure by off-duty employee of a government intelligence agency; man has not been named by Secret Service and has not been charged with a crime.
lead_paragraph: The man, who was at an apartment near the White House when he lost control of the drone, went to bed before reporting the episode, according to law enforcement officials.

byline.original: By MICHAEL D. SHEAR and MICHAEL S. SCHMIDT

snippet: The man, who was at an apartment near the White House when he lost control of the drone, went to bed before reporting the episode, according to law enforcement officials.

headline.main: White House Drone Crash Described as a U.S. Worker’s Drunken Lark
headline.print_headline: White House Drone Crash Described as a U.S. Worker’s Drunken Lark
